column4: hey I need help with getting wammu working...it's asking for the port my phone is on.  I'm doing lsusb but I can't figure out the device I should be using in /dev the one that shows up in the drop down box is: /dev/ttyACM0 when I use it it doesn't connect ...this is one of the last things I need to get rid of windows
maybe someone can suggest a channel? #nokia, #wammu and #gammu all virtually empty
look in dmesg and lshw  to find your phone
I did lsusb and found my found
can't figure out how to access it. wammu says /dev/ttyAMC0 doesn't have a phone on it.  let me try lshw...
what does dmesg say is the port
Bus 004 Device 002: ID 0421:0405 Nokia Mobile Phones 9500 GSM Communicator
if dmesg is not assigning it to that dev then I dunno
dmesg returns a lot what am I looking for?
is there something I can grep for?
you are looking for something like  Nokia Mobile Phone high speed USB on /dev/ttyAMC0
http://nopaste.com/p/aJYzchkkjb
so it is ttyACM1:
sorry hit enter prematurely =) I meant to say that http://nopaste.com/p/aJYzchkkjb is the output in dmesg from unplugging and repluggin the phone
so it is ttyACM1
ok...it was ttyACM0 before
so it claimed let me try that
when you unplug and replug it will reassign, if the driver is still locking ACM0
that makes sense
wammu still claims phone not found...I continued anyways....can't retrieve contacts or anything else
I already made a post on ubuntuforums regarding the issue...I'm going to drop a line on the nokia developers forum
thanks for the pointers....unless you have further suggestions?
